Song.title: O For A Thousand Tongues (Crowder)
Song.copyright: Charles Wesley, David Crowder, Jack Parker. (C) 2007 worshiptogether.com songs, sixsteps Music, Inot Music (all Admin. by EMI Christian Music Publishing)

Arrangement.text:
Verse 1: Oh [G]for a thousand tongues to sing My great Redeemer's pr[Dsus]aise [D]The gl[G]ories of my G[C]od and King The tr[G]iumphs of H[D]is gr[G5]ace [G]
Verse 2: My gr[G]acious Master and my God Assist me to procl[Dsus]aim [D]To spr[G]ead through all the e[C]arth abroad The h[G]onors of Th[D]y n[G]ame [Gsus G2(no3)]
Chorus: So come on[C2(no3)] and sing out[G/B] Let our a[Am11]nthem grow loud [G] There is [C2(no3)]one gr[G/B]eat l[Am11]ove So come on[C2(no3)] and sing out[G/B] Let our a[Am11]nthem grow loud [G] There is [C2(no3)]one gr[G/B]eat l[Am11]ove Jes[G5]us [G Gsus D/G]
{new_page} Verse 3: Jes[G]us the name that charms our fears That bids our sorrows c[Dsus]ease [D]'Tis m[G]usic in the s[C]inner's ears 'Tis l[G]ife and health a[D]nd p[G5]eace [G]
Verse 4: He br[G]eaks the pow'r of canceled sin He sets the pris'ner fr[Dsus]ee [D]His bl[G]ood can make the f[C]oulest clean His bl[G]ood availed f[D]or m[G]e
Verse 5: He sp[G]eaks and list'ning to His voice New life the dead rec[Dsus]eive [D]The m[G]ournful broken h[C]earts rejoice The h[G]umble poor b[D]eli[G]eve
Verse 6: Hear [G]Him, ye deaf, His praise, ye dumb, Your loosened tongues em[Dsus]ploy, [D]Ye [G]blind behold your [C]Savior come, And [G]leap ye lame, [D]for [G]joy
Verse 7: Glor[G]y to God and praise And love be ever ever g[Dsus]iv'n [D]By s[G]aints below and s[C]aints above The ch[G]urch in earth a[D]nd he[G]av'n
Arrangement.searchtext: verse 1 oh for a thousand tongues to sing my great redeemers praise the glories of my god and king the triumphs of his grace verse 2 my gracious master and my god assist me to proclaim to spread through all the earth abroad the honors of thy name chorus so come on and sing out let our anthem grow loud there is one great love so come on and sing out let our anthem grow loud there is one great love jesus verse 3 jesus the name that charms our fears that bids our sorrows cease tis music in the sinners ears tis life and health and peace verse 4 he breaks the powr of canceled sin he sets the prisner free his blood can make the foulest clean his blood availed for me verse 5 he speaks and listning to his voice new life the dead receive the mournful broken hearts rejoice the humble poor believe verse 6 hear him ye deaf his praise ye dumb your loosened tongues employ ye blind behold your savior come and leap ye lame for joy verse 7 glory to god and praise and love be ever ever givn by saints below and saints above the church in earth and heavn

Arrangement.text:
Verse 1: Oh [G]for a thousand tongues to sing My great Redeemer's pr[Dsus]aise [D]The gl[G]ories of my G[C]od and King The tr[G]iumphs of H[D]is gr[G5]ace [G]
Verse 2: My gr[G]acious Master and my God Assist me to procl[Dsus]aim [D]To spr[G]ead through all the e[C]arth abroad The h[G]onors of Th[D]y n[G]ame [Gsus G2(no3)]
Chorus: So come on[C2(no3)] and sing out[G/B] Let our a[Am11]nthem grow loud [G] There is [C2(no3)]one gr[G/B]eat l[Am11]ove So come on[C2(no3)] and sing out[G/B] Let our a[Am11]nthem grow loud [G] There is [C2(no3)]one gr[G/B]eat l[Am11]ove Jes[G5]us [G Gsus D/G]
{new_page} Verse 3: Jes[G]us the name that charms our fears That bids our sorrows c[Dsus]ease [D]'Tis m[G]usic in the s[C]inner's ears 'Tis l[G]ife and health a[D]nd p[G5]eace [G]
Verse 4: He br[G]eaks the pow'r of canceled sin He sets the pris'ner fr[Dsus]ee [D]His bl[G]ood can make the f[C]oulest clean His bl[G]ood availed f[D]or m[G]e
Verse 5: He sp[G]eaks and list'ning to His voice New life the dead rec[Dsus]eive [D]The m[G]ournful broken h[C]earts rejoice The h[G]umble poor b[D]eli[G]eve
{key:A} Verse 6: Hear [A]Him, ye deaf, His praise, ye dumb, Your loosened tongues em[Esus]ploy, [E]Ye [A]blind behold your [D]Savior come, And [A]leap ye lame, [E]for [A]joy
Verse 7: Glor[A]y to God and praise And love be ever ever g[Esus]iv'n [E]By s[A]aints below and s[D]aints above The ch[A]urch in earth a[E]nd he[A]av'n
